title: Why are some African countries banning US citizens from entry?
summary: Mali and Burkina Faso are the latest to issue 'tit-for-tat' bans on visas for US citizens with immediate effect.

title: LIVE: Israel’s ban on 37 aid groups kicks in, Gaza starts 2026 with despair
summary: Heavy rain, thunderstorms and hail is expected across Palestine, according to the Palestinian Meteorological Department.

title: Israel escalates West Bank demolitions amid illegal settlement expansion
summary: Bulldozers flatten refugee housing while Israel approves 126 settler housing units and targets UN agencies.

title: Gaza’s new year begins with a struggle for survival and dignity
summary: Sanaa and Batoul embody Gaza's resilience, facing war, famine, and loss with little hope for a better life.

title: Palestine was the deadliest place to be a journalist in 2025: Media union
summary: Of 128 journalists killed globally last year, 56 were Palestinian, the International Federation of Journalists said.

title: Zohran Mamdani sworn in as New York City’s mayor
summary: Zohran Mamdani has been sworn in as mayor of New York City, becoming the first Muslim to hold the office.

title: Photos: Zohran Mamdani becomes New York City’s first Muslim mayor
summary: Making history, Mamdani took his oath with his hand placed on a Quran.

title: Several killed in blaze at Swiss ski resort town: Police
summary: The New Year's Eve fire occurred in a bar called Le Constellation in the Swiss town of Crans Montana.

title: All the big elections to look out for in 2026
summary: From the February vote in Bangladesh to the November US midterms, here is a calendar of key election dates.

title: Zohran Mamdani takes oath as New York mayor with historic Quran
summary: Incoming mayor uses edition symbolising New York City history; to use two family Qurans in public ceremony on Friday.

title: Zohran Mamdani sworn in as New York City mayor
summary: Mamdani, the US city's first Muslim mayor, is also the youngest person to be inaugurated in generations.

title: China’s Xi says ‘reunification’ with Taiwan ‘unstoppable’
summary: Taiwan's Lai pledges to defend national sovereignty after Beijing holds live-fire drills around island.

title: Iran : issue d'une vraie vidéo, l'image iconique d'un manifestant est partiellement modifiée par IA
summary: L‘image d’un manifestant assis seul face à la police est devenue un symbole du mouvement contre le coût de la vie en Iran. Mais cette image, issue d'une vraie vidéo prise, a été modifiée et améliorée par intelligence artificielle.

title: Des véhicules militaires, des propriétaires émiratis… Que sait-on des bateaux bombardés au Yémen ?
summary: Des images et des données en sources ouvertes permettent de confirmer que les bateaux bombardés par la coalition menée par l’Arabie saoudite, le 30 décembre à Al-Mukalla au Yémen, provenaient bien des Émirats et transportaient des véhicules militaires émiratis utilisés par un groupe séparatiste.

title: Israël menace de suspendre l'accès de plus de trente ONG internationales à Gaza
summary: Israël a annoncé, mardi, que les ONG présentes à Gaza n'ayant pas transmis la liste de leurs employés palestiniens d'ici 24 heures verraient leurs licences annulées dès 2026. Les autorités israéliennes ont engagé cette procédure en visant notamment MSF, dont deux membres sont accusés "d’activités terroristes".

title: Séparatistes au Yémen : qui sont-ils, que veulent-ils et pourquoi leur progression change la donne
summary: Au Yémen, un nouvel acteur s’impose. En quelques semaines, les séparatistes du Conseil de transition du Sud ont conquis de vastes territoires stratégiques du pays. Soutenus par Abu Dhabi, accusés de menace par Riyad, ils fragilisent un peu plus un pays déjà morcelé par la guerre. Explications de Franck Mermier, anthropologue et directeur de recherche émérite au CNRS, spécialiste du Yémen.

title: Syrie : couvre-feu à Lattaquié après des violences contre la communauté alaouite
summary: Un couvre-feu est entré en vigueur mardi après-midi à Lattaquié, ville côtière de l'ouest de la Syrie, au lendemain d'une attaque dans des quartiers à majorité alaouite. Selon l'OSDH, un alaouite a été tué, tandis que la télévision d'État rapporte l'arrestation de 21 personnes "appartenant aux vestiges de l'ancien régime".

title: Au Yémen, l’Arabie saoudite bombarde pour rappeler ses "alliés" à l’ordre
summary: Le bombardement par l'Arabie saoudite de la ville yéménite d’Al-Moukalla, mardi, a visé des intérêts émiratis. Si les Émirats arabes unis sont un allié dans la lutte contre les Houthis, ils sont aussi un rival géopolitique et le principal sponsor d’un mouvement séparatiste qui inquiète de plus en plus Riyad.

title: À Gaza, la crise humanitaire fait rage malgré le cessez-le-feu
summary: Dans la bande de Gaza, le cessez-le-feu en vigueur depuis le 10 octobre n'a pas mis fin à la crise humanitaire. Frappée par la malnutrition et ne recevant qu'une aide au compte-gouttes, la population endure son troisième hiver dans un territoire dévasté.

title: Yémen : après un ultimatum de l'Arabie saoudite, les Émirats annoncent le retrait de leurs forces
summary: Les Émirats arabes unis, soutien du mouvement séparatiste du Conseil de transition du Sud (STC), ont annoncé mardi le retrait de leurs forces restantes au Yémen, après que l'Arabie saoudite, alliée du gouvernement yéménite, a fixé un délai de 24 heures pour leur départ.

title: Le Hamas confirme la mort de son porte-parole Abou Obeida, revendiquée par Israël en août
summary: La mort d'Abou Obeida, porte-parole de la branche armée du Hamas depuis 2002, a été confirmée lundi par les Brigades al-Qassam, plusieurs mois après qu'Israël avait affirmé l'avoir tué. Il avait notamment annoncé les attaques du 7-Octobre. Un nouveau responsable reprend son nom et ses fonctions.

title: À Mar-a-Lago, Benjamin Netanyahu et Donald Trump mettent en garde le Hamas et l'Iran
summary: Le Premier ministre israélien s'est entretenu, lundi, à Mar-a-Lago, en Floride, avec le président américain. Les deux hommes ont mis en garde l'Iran contre toute tentative de réarmement et le Hamas en cas de non-respect du plan de paix pour Gaza. Il s'agit de la cinquième entrevue aux États-Unis entre les deux dirigeants depuis le retour à la Maison Blanche de Donald Trump.

title: Syrie : plusieurs personnes tuées dans une manifestation d'alaouites après l'attaque d'une mosquée
summary: Des milliers de manifestants appartenant à la communauté alaouite sont descendus dans la rue, dimanche, en Syrie, deux jours après l'attaque d'une de leurs mosquées qui a fait huit morts. Au moins trois personnes ont été tuées et des dizaines de personnes ont été blessées lors d'affrontements entre les différents groupes de manifestants et les forces de l'ordre.

title: Iran-Israël : le récit des 12 jours de guerre ouverte
summary: Du 13 au 24 juin 2025, Israël et l’Iran s'affrontent à coups de missiles et de frappes aériennes. Un conflit qui affaiblit considérablement la République islamique, touche durement certaines villes israéliennes et dont l'issue est décidée dans le Bureau ovale. En lettres capitales sur son réseau social, c'est Donald Trump qui lui a donné son nom : “La guerre des douze jours”. Récit.

title: « Il est impératif que l’Europe soit plus indépendante dans le domaine numérique »
summary: Dans une tribune au « Monde », d’anciens collègues de Thierry Breton, dont Margrethe Vestager, l’ancien conseiller spécial pour l’intelligence artificielle de la présidence de la Commission européenne et des membres du projet Europa Power Initiative reviennent sur les sanctions imposées par les Etats-Unis à plusieurs responsables européens pour leur rôle dans la régulation de la tech.

title: EN DIRECT, incendie à Crans-Montana : la police annonce de « nombreuses victimes » dans le bar suisse après une explosion dont l’origine reste « indéterminée »
summary: Une explosion suivie d’un incendie s’est déclenchée dans un établissement de la station du Valais, pendant les festivités du Nouvel An. Aucun bilan précis n’a encore été communiqué.

title: Le président taïwanais s’engage à « défendre fermement la souveraineté » de l’île après les manœuvres militaires chinoises
summary: Pékin a fustigé les propos truffés de « mensonges » de Lai Ching-te, le président de Taïwan, ajoutant que M. Lai avait « incité à la confrontation » entre les deux rives du détroit de Taïwan, selon l’agence de presse Chine nouvelle.

title: Manifestations en Iran : un membre des forces de l’ordre tué dans l’ouest du pays, selon la télévision d’Etat
summary: Il s’agit de la première victime officiellement recensée depuis le début de ces rassemblements dimanche contre la vie chère.

title: En Suisse, plusieurs morts lors d’une explosion dans un bar de la station de ski de Crans-Montana
summary: L’accident, d’origine inconnue, a fait plusieurs morts et des blessés à Crans-Montana, une station de ski du canton de Valais, en Suisse, a annoncé jeudi la police.

title: Zohran Mamdani est devenu officiellement maire de New York
summary: A 34 ans, il est le premier maire musulman de la plus grande ville américaine. « C’est véritablement l’honneur et le privilège d’une vie », a déclaré le jeune élu lors de son intronisation jeudi aux premières minutes de l’année 2026.

title: Quatre ans de guerre en Ukraine ont redéfini l’Union européenne, contrainte de devenir plus « géopolitique »
summary: Avec l’agression de l’Ukraine par la Russie, le monde dans lequel s’était construite l’UE a disparu. Les Vingt-Sept ont compris tardivement que la paix n’était « plus acquise en Europe » et pris alors conscience de leur faiblesse militaire et de leur dépendance énergétique.

title: Divisés, en crise politique et sans budget, les Bulgares rejoignent l’euro
summary: La Bulgarie passe à la monnaie unique européenne le 1ᵉʳ janvier, mais la population est sans enthousiasme. Le pays a seulement un gouvernement par intérim, et la corruption est endémique.

title: Immigration : plus de 41 000 personnes ont traversé la Manche pour rejoindre le Royaume-Uni en 2025, au plus haut depuis 2022
summary: Au moins 29 migrants sont morts en mer pendant l’année écoulée, selon un comptage effectué par l’Agence France-Presse à partir de sources officielles françaises et britanniques.

title: Au Yémen, les séparatistes annoncent un accord avec des forces gouvernementales
summary: Le Conseil de transition du Sud, groupe séparatiste qui a pris le contrôle de nombreux territoires, a affirmé qu’il mènerait désormais ses opérations en collaboration avec les forces gouvernementales du Bouclier national.

title: Les Etats-Unis affirment avoir tué huit personnes dans de nouvelles frappes sur des navires supposés transporter de la drogue
summary: Le commandement américain pour l’Amérique latine et les Caraïbes a dit avoir ciblé plusieurs bateaux mardi et mercredi, sans préciser le lieu où ils se trouvaient.

title: EN DIRECT, guerre en Ukraine : « Ceux qui pensent que l’Ukraine est prête à se rendre se trompent profondément », avertit Volodymyr Zelensky
summary: Dans son message de vœux aux Ukrainiens, le président Zelesnky a affirmé que l’accord de paix est « prêt à 90 % » mais que les 10 % restants « contiennent tout ». « Ce sont ces 10 % qui détermineront le destin de la paix, le destin de l’Ukraine et de l’Europe », a-t-il déclaré.

title: Guterres says Israeli rules blocking Unrwa violate international law
summary:
Guterres says Israeli rules blocking Unrwa violate international law

UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Wednesday said that Israel seeks to further impede Unrwa's ability to operate in Gaza, adding that Israeli regulations are inconsistent with the international legal framework. 

"The Law and its amendments are inconsistent with the status and international legal framework applicable to Unrwa and must be immediately repealed," Guterres said in a statement, according to his spokesman Stephane Dujarric.

The UN agency is covered by the Convention on the Privileges and Immunities of the UN, which extends to its assets, property, officials and personnel, Guterres said.

"Unrwa's continued operations in Gaza contribute to the effective implementation of Security Council resolution 2803 (2025) and the Comprehensive Plan to End the Gaza Conflict on the ground," he added.

On Monday, the Israeli Parliament approved a bill to cut electricity and water supplies to the Unrwa offices.

title: Israeli settlers attack farm northwest of Nablus, reports say
summary:
Israeli settlers attack farm northwest of Nablus, reports say

Israeli settlers on Thursday attacked a farm in the Masoudiya plain, near the village of Burqa, northwest of Nablus, Palestinian media reports said. 

Palestinian activist Dhiab Hajji said that dozens of settlers attacked a farm belonging to the Saleh family and destroyed security cameras.

title: Israeli forces attack Palestinian man, then shoot rescuer four times
summary:
Israeli forces attack Palestinian man, then shoot rescuer four times

Israeli gunfire wounded two Palestinians on Thursday, south of Nablus, local media reports said. 

Wafa news agency reported that the two young men were shot by Israeli forces at the village entrance on the main road between Ramallah and Nablus.

The head of the Al-Lubban ash-Sharqiya village council, Yaqoub Awais, said that one of them was in critical condition and the second wounded man was taken to Salfit Hospital after being shot four times while trying to rescue the first.

title: Israeli forces detonate explosives in Nablus apartment, arrest four Palestinians
summary:
Israeli forces detonate explosives in Nablus apartment, arrest four Palestinians

Israeli forces on Thursday detonated explosives inside a residential apartment in Nablus and arrested four Palestinians, Wafa news agency reported. 

Israeli forces stormed Nablus, surrounded an apartment belonging to the Hasiba family behind the National Hospital, and detonated explosives inside after arresting Rami Hasiba and his son, Ahmed, the report said. 

The report said that Israeli forces also stormed a house in the Yasmina neighbourhood and arrested Mo'men al Dabik.

Hani Abu Leil was arrested after Israeli forces raided his home in the Old Askar refugee camp.

title: Netanyahu calls violent settlers attacking Palestinians 'a handful of kids'
summary:
Netanyahu calls violent settlers attacking Palestinians 'a handful of kids'

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Tuesday said that violent settlers who attack Palestinians were only “a handful of kids” who are not from the West Bank. 

In an interview with Fox News, Netanyahu said, “When they’re talking about it, they’re talking about a handful of kids."

“They’re actually teenagers who come from broken homes, and they do things like chopping olive trees, and sometimes they try to burn a home,” he said.  

Netanyahu, who is currently on a trip to the US, is wanted by the International Criminal Court, which has issued an arrest warrant against him following an investigation of war crimes and crimes against humanity.

title: Israel approves plan for 126 settler homes in West Bank
summary:
Israel approves plan for 126 settler homes in West Bank

Israeli authorities approved the construction of 126 settler homes in the Sanur outpost in the northern West Bank, which was evacuated in 2005, local media reported.

Israeli news media Channel 7 reported that the High Planning Council approved a detailed plan allowing illegal settlers to return to Sanur.

The report said that the plan is expected to take effect within two months, enabling illegal settlers to return.

title: Palestinian prisoners denied drinking water in Israeli prisons, report says
summary:
Palestinian prisoners denied drinking water in Israeli prisons, report says

A report by the public defender’s office of the Israeli justice ministry said that Israeli authorities denied Palestinian detainees access to drinking water for periods up to 12 hours as a form of collective punishment. 

Haaretz newspaper reported that Palestinian “security prisoners” were prevented from accessing drinking water in some cases for half a day.

The findings were based on three visits by public defender representatives to Ketziot Prison in southern Israel in May, June and September 2024.

title: Israel attacks Gaza by air, ground and sea; intense strikes hit Khan Younis
summary:
Israel attacks Gaza by air, ground and sea; intense strikes hit Khan Younis

Israeli aircraft on Thursday launched an air strike targeting the eastern part of Khan Younis city, in southern Gaza, as Israeli gunboats fired flares over the sea off the coast of city. 

Local media said that Israeli military vehicles opened fire north of the city of Rafah and reported a series of air strikes targeting the city. 

Intense firing was also reported from areas east of Gaza City, where Israeli forces detonated car bombs in the Tuffah and Sanafoura neighbourhoods.

title: Morning update
summary:
Morning update

Good morning, Middle East Eye readers. Here are the latest updates from Gaza, where Israel continues to violate the ceasefire more than two months after it came into effect:

  • Three Palestinians were wounded in Israeli army gunfire east of Maghazi camp, while two others were wounded in the Nuseirat, and Bureij refugee camp where Israeli tanks opened fire. 

  • Israeli aircraft launched an air strike targeting the eastern part of Khan Younis, as Israeli gunboats fired flares over the sea off the coast of the city. Army vehicles also opened fire north of Rafah.  

  • Israeli forces detonated car bombs in the Tuffah and Sanafoura neighbourhoods, east of Gaza City, as drones opened fire near the area. 

  • Local press reported artillery shelling on Jabalia camp in northern Gaza. 

  • The Israeli military prosecution admitted to withholding water from prisoners as "collective punishment" during the genocidal war.

title: Netanyahu meets with evangelical Christian leaders
summary:
Netanyahu meets with evangelical Christian leaders

Israeli UN ambassador Danny Danon and Israeli prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu met with evangelical Christian leaders in the US, Haaretz reported on Wednesday.

Danon said in a post on X that evangelical Christians have a' "deep commitment to the State of Israel is inspiring," adding that "our shared values will fortify the bond between both our nations."

title: West Bank: Israeli soldiers raid town, wound two people and take money
summary:
West Bank: Israeli soldiers raid town, wound two people and take money

Israeli soldiers raided a town south of Hebron, shot and wounded two Palestinians and removed money from a gold shop, Wafa news agency reported on Wednesday.  

Local sources told Wafa that soldiers stormed the town of Dhahiriya, firing bullets at residents.

A school student and young man were wounded during the indiscriminate shooting. Both were transferred to a hospital in Hebron for treatment.

The soldiers also raided a gold shop belonging to the al-Hurub family, detained several Palestinians, and took money from the store.

title: Israel blows up last standing house in border town in Lebanon that it has occupied
summary:
Israel blows up last standing house in border town in Lebanon that it has occupied

The Israeli army has blown up the last house that was standing in a border town in southern Lebanon that they have destroyed and occupied, Al Jazeera reported on Wednesday.

Israel conducted a series of strikes on southern and eastern Lebanon until a ceasefire agreement in November 2024, which it continues to violate on an almost daily basis.

title: President appoints Farzin as his special economic aide
summary: Tehran, IRNA - President Masoud Pezeshkian has appointed Mohammad-Reza Farzin as his special economic aide, after he accepted his resignation as governor of the Central Bank of the Islamic Republic of Iran.

title: Iran warns IAEA of US threats against its nuclear facilities
summary: London, IRNA - Iran’s permanent mission to the United Nations office in Geneva has warned the UN nuclear watchdog that any renewed military aggression against the country’s nuclear facilities would have “severe consequences” for “the global non-proliferation regime.”

summary: Tehran, IRNA – Mohammad Kazem Al-Sadeq, ambassador of the Islamic Republic of Iran to Baghdad, met and held talks with Haibat Al-Halbousi, the newly elected speaker of the Iraqi Parliament on Wednesday.

title: Araghchi meets new ambassadors of Lebanon, Kyrgyzstan and Germany in Tehran
summary: Tehran, IRNA – The new ambassadors of several countries in Tehran met with Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi on Wednesday.

title: Strategic Council on Foreign Relations secretary meets Foreign Minister Araghchi
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Jalal Dehghani Firouzabadi, the secretary of the Strategic Council for Foreign Relations, met and held talks with Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi, while attending the Ministry of Foreign Affairs on Wednesday.

title: Iran urges regional states to help preserve Yemen’s territorial integrity
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Ministry spokesman Esmail Baqaei has stressed the role of regional countries in safeguarding Yemen’s territorial integrity, saying any action that fuels instability in the country or insecurity in the region is unacceptable.

title: Araghchi says Yemen crisis should be resolved through inclusive talks
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iran believes the Yemen crisis can only be resolved through dialogue among all Yemeni groups, Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi said during a phone call with his Bahraini counterpart on Wednesday.

title: Iran appoints Abdolnasser Hemmati as Central Bank governor
summary: Tehran, IRNA – President Masoud Pezeshkian has appointed Abdolnasser Hemmati as governor of the Central Bank of Iran, according to a presidential decree issued on Wednesday.

title: Pezeshkian urges unity, constructive criticism amid economic pressures
summary: Tehran, IRNA – President Masoud Pezeshkian says that cohesion, mutual support, and effective criticism are essential for steering the country through its current difficulties and laying the groundwork for lasting reforms.

title: Gen. Vahidi named new deputy commander in chief of IRGC
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Major General Ahmad Vahidi has been appointed as the new Deputy Commander-in-Chief of the Islamic Revolution Guards Corps (IRGC) by Leader of the Islamic Revolution Ayatollah Seyyed Ali Khamenei.

title: Iran Parliament approves accession to Makkah Treaty to boost anti-corruption cooperation
summary: Tehran, IRNA – The Iranian Parliament has approved the government’s accession to the “Makkah Al-Mukarramah Convention of the Member States of the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation on Anti-Corruption Law Enforcement Cooperation,” an international agreement under the Organization of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) aimed at enhancing cooperation among law enforcement agencies to combat corruption.

title: Pezeshkian: Iran’s response to any aggression will be regret-inducing
summary: President Pezeshkian says Iran’s response to any oppressive aggression will be hard and regret-inducing.

title: Israeli airstrike killed 15 family members in Gaza in 2024
summary: TEHRAN, Jan. 01 (MNA) – An investigation led by a Geneva-headquartered human rights body has detailed the circumstances surrounding an Israeli airstrike that killed 15 members of a single family in Rafah in southern Gaza Strip February 2024.

summary: TEHRAN, Jan. 01 (MNA) – The US military has launched new attacks on the vessels targeting two boats allegedly used by members of drug cartels, killing five people, the US Southern Command said.

summary: TEHRAN, Jan. 01 (MNA) – On January 3, Earth will reach its closest point to the Sun.

summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 31 (MNA) – An informed source in Iran's Ministry of Intelligence announced Wednesday the identification and arrest of 7 elements affiliated with adversary groups based in the Western countries.

summary: SHAHR-e KORD, Dec. 31 (MNA) – President Masoud Pezeshkian of Iran arrived in Shahr-Kord on Wednesday as part of his visits to the provinces to listen to people's demands and inspect the implementation of the government's projects.

title: Iran closely watching developments in Yemen: spox
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 31 (MNA) – Iranian foreign ministry spokesman has said that Iran closely follows developments in Yemen, stressing the need to preserve Yemen’s unity and territorial integrity.

title: Iran futsal team to play two friendlies with Iraq
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 31 (MNA) – The Head of Iran’s Futsal League Organization announced that the national futsal team will play two friendly matches against Iraq as part of their preparations for the 2026 AFC Futsal Asian Cup.

title: اینفوگرافیک؛ ثبت ۲۰۸ مورد تولد چند قلو در گیلان
summary: رشت- در ۹ ماهه گذشته دویست و هشت تولد چند قلو در گیلان ثبت شد که ۲۰۳ دوقلو و پنج ۳ قلو بوده است.

title: پایان تصویربرداری تله‌تئاتر «قاب زندگی» در قزوین
summary: قزوین- تصویربرداری تله‌تئاتر «قاب زندگی» در عمارت تاریخی سعدالسلطنه قزوین به پایان رسید.

title: حلقه‌های صالحین کانون تبیین اندیشه‌های رهبری درباره حکومت اسلامی
summary: بیرجند- مدیر آموزش معاونت سازمان تعلیم و تربیت بسیج کشور گفت: تبیین اندیشه‌های مقام معظم رهبری پیرامون حکومت اسلامی در حلقه های صالحین اجرایی شده است.

title: سردار مهدوی: پرچم مبارزه با دشمن در دست جوانان است
summary: بیرجند- فرمانده سپاه انصار الرضا(ع) گفت: جوانان امروز پرچم اسلام را به دوش گرفته و در تمام صحنه‌های جنگی با استکبار مبارزه می‌کنند.

title: آملی لاریجانی:انتقاد از نحوه اداره کشور حق تک‌تک آحاد ملت است
summary: مشهد- رئیس مجمع تشخیص مصلحت نظام با اشاره به حق انتقاد مردم گفت: انتقاد از نحوه اداره کشور حق تک‌تک آحاد ملت است.

title: حکیم‌زاده: انگیزه و اشتیاق معلمان خوزستان در اجرای طرح‌های تحولی مشهود
summary: اهواز – معاون آموزش ابتدایی وزارت آموزش‌وپرورش، اجرای طرح حامی و سایر برنامه‌های تحولی دولت چهاردهم در مدارس خوزستان را مثبت ارزیابی کرد.
